original: Engström, Knut August, länsveterinär, Mariestad, f. 17/9/86 i Valdemarsvik av grosshandl. Philip E. o. Sofia Peterson. G. 13 m. Emmy Mahrle. Barn: Knut Bertil f. 14. — Stud:ex. 07, veterinärex. 12, länsveterinärex. 24, kurs f. äldre veterinärer v. veterinär-högsk. 29. Stud:res. t. veterinärhögsk. i Berlin, Dresden, München, Wien o. Budapest 21 o. 39. Aman. v. veterinärhögsk. 10-12, bat :veterinär i Fvk res. 15-22, tf. förest, f. veterinärin-rättn. i Skara 12, distr :veterinär i Rävlanda 12-25, i Karlshamn 26-33, exp :besiktn :veterinär där 26-33, tf. stadsveterinär 27-33, tf. byråveterinär h. medic:styr. 30, länsveterinär i Skarab. 1. sed. 33, besiktn :veterinär o. förest. v. Mariestads köttbesiktn :byrå s. å., överveterinär v. bekämp. av mul-o. klövsjuka i länet 38-39. E. lär. v. Sätila lantmisk. 20-26. Led. av hälso-v:nd i Karlshamn 26-33, v. ordf. i Skarab. 1. hush:sällsk. tub :komm. sed. 35, ordf. i lokalavd. av Riksfören. f. svenskh. bev. i uti. o. i Mariestads manskör, stift, av Veterinärmed. fören. 10, dess förste ordf., rev. i Sv. läns-veterinärfören. sed. 35, ordf. i Skarab. 1. veterinärfören. sed. 44, led. av stadsfullm. i Mariestad 44-46 samt av hälsov:ndn, fam:bidr:ndn o. stadens ortsnamnkomm. Utg. en del skr. i veterinärmed. ämnen. RVO.
translated: Engström, Knut August, county veterinarian, Mariestad, born on September 17, 1886 in Valdemarsvik to wholesale merchant Philip E. and Sofia Peterson. Married for 13 years to Emmy Mahrle. Children: Knut Bertil born in 1914. Graduated from high school in 1907, veterinary school in 1912, and became a county veterinarian in 1924. Attended courses for senior veterinarians at the veterinary college in 1929 and studied abroad at the veterinary colleges in Berlin, Dresden, Munich, Vienna and Budapest in 1921 and 1939. Served as an assistant at the veterinary college from 1910-1912, as a veterinary surgeon in the military reserve from 1915-1922, acting head of the veterinary forensic department in Skara in 1912, district veterinarian in Rävlanda from 1912-1925, in Karlshamn from 1926-1933, and as an inspection veterinarian and acting city veterinarian from 1927-1933. He was acting bureau veterinarian for the medical board and became a county veterinarian in Skaraborg in 1933. Appointed as an inspection veterinarian and head of Mariestad's meat inspection bureau that same year, and as an overseeing veterinarian for combatting hoof and mouth disease in the county from 1938-1939. Taught at Sätila agricultural school from 1920-1926. He was a member of the health committee in Karlshamn from 1926-1933, vice chairman of the Skaraborg County Household Society Tuberculosis Commission from 1935, chairman of the local branch of the National Association for Swedish Homeland Protection abroad and in Mariestad's male choir, member of the foundation of the Veterinary Medical Society from 1910 (and became its first chairman), and a member of the Swedish County Veterinarian Society from 1935 and chairman of the Skaraborg County Veterinarian Society from 1944. He was also a member of the city council in Mariestad from 1944-1946 and of various committees related to health, family welfare, and place names. Published several works on veterinary medicine and was appointed a Knight of the Order of Vasa.
